Package au.edu.anu.rscs.aot.util

Class IntegerRange

java.lang.Object
au.edu.anu.rscs.aot.util.IntegerRange
public class IntegerRange extends Object

A class to represent ranges of integer numbers. Fully compatible with UML multiplicities, in particular accepts the '*' notation for 'any number'.

Author:
Shayne Flint - 2012

  • Constructor Details

    • IntegerRange

      public IntegerRange​(int first, int last)
      Constructor from two numbers. Throws an Exception if first > last.
      Parameters:
      first - the lowest end of the range
      last - the upper end of the range

    • IntegerRange

      public IntegerRange​(String str)
      Constructor from a String.

      Examples of valid String formats:
      1..1
      1..*
      0..1
      0..*
      5..12

      Parameters:
      str - a String representing an integer range.

    • inRange

      public boolean inRange​(int value)
      Checks that a value is within the range.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to test
      Returns:
      true if the value is ≥ range minimum and ≤ range maximum.

    • check

      public void check​(int value)
      Checks that a value is within the range. Throws an Exception if the value is ≥ range minimum and ≤ range maximum.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to test

      public IntegerRange setFirst​(int first)
      Reset the range lower end.
      Parameters:
      first - the new lower end.
      Returns:

    • setLast

      public IntegerRange setLast​(int last)
      Reset the range upper end.
      Parameters:
      last - the new upper end.
      Returns:
      this (fluid interface).

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(IntegerRange r)
      Checks if a range is contained in this one.
      Parameters:
      r - the IntegerRange to test
      Returns:
      true if r is fully contained in this instance range.
